I was very fortunate last year to have the opportunity to deliver a keynote=
 talk to the SPLASH conference about a number of issues of interest to NEAT=
 Users, including novelty search and Picbreeder (both of which run with NEA=
T), and I took that opportunity to try to connect these ideas to larger iss=
ues of innovation and human discovery, and misconceptions that we tend to h=
ave about search in general.  Also fortunately, the video was recorded and =
just appeared online at InfoQ, complete with slides shown in parallel in th=
e same window:

http://www.infoq.com/presentations/Searching-Without-Object=
ives

I hope some of you will find the talk interesting; it gave me a chanc=
e to connect a lot of different topics that normally don't go together in p=
ublications, so it provides a kind of unique perspective on some of the res=
earch surrounding NEAT from the last few years.  Hopefully it will show how=
 some seemingly unconnected projects are actually closely related conceptua=
lly.  

Of course, I am happy to hear your thoughts,

ken

PS Depending on =
your screen size, you may want to choose the "horizontal" viewing option in=
 the gray bar in the upper part of the screen to be able to see video and s=
lides at the same time more easily.
